title: Kindergarten-Font - various {gang}
content:
Hello,   
   
i'm searching for a nice headline font for a kindergarten-flyer.   
   
it would be great if it is script font.   
   
If you have an idea please tell me, where i can buy your fouvourite kindergarten-font.   
   
Thanks alot   
   
Sorry for my bad english
author: anonymous

comments.content:
For a headline you could also use Spills from [Comicraft Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www2.comicbookfonts.com/e/env/0001zCGFPmuQPWQktM211i9/search.html?link=/fonts/DL/catalog.html&item=fonts:dl205)   
   
I liked also the Radio from the post above, nice font.

You are right Yves, Type O Tones has nice fonts, and it is not script but [Adelita Ole](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/p_fonts/p_adeli.htm) will also make a nice headline, specially if you color the balls ... (I did that once for a Kids story book with a very similar font I had to do myself, I was not aware then of the online foundries, not even the spanish ones!)

If you are looking for something that looks like the writing of children, I have many samples of fonts [in the Script Font ID Guide, Part 12](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script12Pg1.html). If you see some that you like, you can find who sells them by using the supplier codes in the [Font Reference List](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ListPages/ScriptListAB.html).   
   
(see Oscar, I learn quickly!)

It's not a script, but I like [nylon](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.the-letterbox.com.au/lab/fonts/fonts4nylon.html) from Australia's [The Letterbox](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.the-letterbox.com.au/).   
   
It's like a hyperactive Cooper Black.
Stephen, how do you make the links open in a new window? I tried \<a href="link" target="blank"\> but it doesn't work.

[Thanks Yves](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.typophile.com/)   
   
Now where can I find all these board specific codes?   
   
I'm full of questions, aren't I?

[MeMima](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/p_fonts/p_memi.htm) from Type-o-Tones has this distinct child-like   
feel to it. And [FF Prater Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=FF011199X1P2&start=1) is _tr_

Bit of trivia: MeMima is used for [Martha Stewart Baby](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.marthastewart.com/page.jhtml;jsessionid=A0VVJOXU3J545WCKUU2SGWWYJKSS2JO0?type=product&id=product20026&rsc=sr9006) magazine.

Shhh... Stephen went to bed one and a half hour ago,   
you might wake him up.   
   
I use the board specific code, it's very simple and   
it works perfectly. In this case, it's   
   
\newurl{http://www.hatever.com/, whatever}

You sure are! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/wink.gif)   
   
Top of any page in Typophile Forums:   
   
Topics | **Help** | Active Members | Last 1|3|7 Days | Tree View   
   
Go to **Help** , then to subtopic [Formatting](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/discus.pl?pg=formatting)

Sauna Swash Black Italic by UNDERWARE   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/underware/sauna/swash-black-italic/testdrive.html?s=Kindergarten&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/underware/sauna/swash-black-italic/testdrive.html?s=Kindergarten&p=72)   
   
or Radio by THIRSTYPE   
 [http://www.thirstype.com/action\_radio.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20110306212855/http:/www.thirstype.com/action_radio.html)
